conversation.content: I'm probably being really dumb but, um, I got charged forty-seven dollars extra on my card?
Oh no worries at all! Let me—actually wait—let me pull up your account. What's your order number?
Let me see here... it's, uh, ORD-2947-BK. I think maybe I clicked something wrong?
Got it. Pulling that up now. So I can—hmm—okay I see what happened. You purchased from our UK store. The charge. It's showing £285.00 which converted to $337.47.
Wait, I sort of thought it was in dollars already? God, I'm so stupid.
No no no! Not stupid. At all. This happens—er—let me check something. The UK site. It doesn't always. Show the conversion clearly.
Okay so that means... wait, there's another fee too, right? I'm looking at my statement.
Right right. So your bank—they charged—hang on. Yes. $12.50 for the foreign transaction. On top of the conversion. I'm gonna make sure. We get you a credit for that.
Oh you don't have to, I mean, this is probably my fault for not reading properly.
Stop that! Not your fault. Look I'm—actually no—I'm applying. Store credit. Code CRD-9847-X. Worth $15.00. To cover that bank fee.
Hmm, but what if I order internationally again? Like, maybe I should just learn how this works?
Smart thinking. So here's—okay—here's what I'll do. Setting up. An alert. On your account. Profile code INT-ALERT-7. Anytime you're on a foreign site. Big warning. Shows exact USD conversion.
That's really nice but, er, I feel bad taking credits when I probably should've known better.
Listen. The system—it should be—look it's not clear enough. That's on us. Your new total. After credit. It's $334.97. Already processed.
Okay so wait, let me think... if the original was three thirty-seven, then... oh God, there's tax too isn't there?
No no. International orders. No additional tax. The £285.00. That included. UK VAT already. Twenty percent. Built in.
Jesus, twenty percent? Erhm, sorry, now I'm worried about my other order from Germany.
Let me—hold on—checking your history. I see it. Order GMY-4429-Q. That one. Already shipped. Total was €189.00. Converted to $206.71. No surprises there.
Oh thank God. Okay so basically just, um, always check the currency symbol, right?
Exactly. But also. The alert I set up. It'll catch it. Every time. Promise. You're protected now.

scenario: trying to understand international transaction fees
